scheme.name: Ladli Scheme
scheme.award_entitlement:
Under the scheme financial assistance is provided in the form of term deposits - Rs. 11,000/- if GIRL CHILD is born in hospital or Rs. 10,000/- if GIRL CHILD is born at home at the time of registration and Rs.5,000/- each in further five milestones i.e., Class I, VI, IX, XI & XII.
Maturity amount at the end of lock-in-period will vary depending on the stage at which each girl child enters the scheme and registers under it. The girls registered under the scheme shall file a maturity claim after:
  1. Turning 18 years old and passing 10th standard or
  2. Completing 12th standard
The maturity amount will depend on the stage at which the child enrolled in the scheme.
Applicable for 2 GIRL CHILD per parents only
scheme.eligibility:
1. Born in Delhi as shown by the birth certificate issued by MCD
  2. If girl is going to school, her school must be recognized by Delhi Govt. / MCD / NDMC.
  3. Benefit of the scheme is limited to 2 surviving girls per family.
scheme.document_required:
1. Duly filled Application Form
  2. 3 years residence proof in Delhi prior to registration
  3. Income Certificate/Affidavit showing annual income of the family
  4. Birth certificate of the girl child issued by MCD
  5. Group photo of parents with the girl child.
  6. Caste certificate in case of SC/ST/OBC.
  7. Copy of Aadhar Card of the parents and the child, if available.
  8. ank account details
scheme.application_link:
Apply at http://www.wcddel.in/streesakti_3Ladli.html
Enrolment in scheme is also done by schools and DWCD District Offices
scheme.grievance_redressal:
Helpline: 011-23832588, 1800229090

scholarship.name: Pre Matric Scholarship for OBC Students
scholarship.award_entitlement: Scholarship award will be sanctioned to OBC students studying in class IX and X on a full-time basis in Government schools.They would be entitled to Rs. 4000/- annually.
scholarship.eligibility:
1. Students studying (Class IX & X) in Government Schools.
  2. Regular attendance record should not be less than 75% in the previous year should be pre- requisite for availing scholarship
  3. Only 2 boys of the same parents/guardian will be entitled to receive scholarships. This restriction will, however, not apply to girls. Accordingly, scholarships availed by girls of same parents/guardian will not adversely affect admissibility of availing schclarship upto two boys of same parents/guardian.
  4. The Applicant should not be availing benefits under any other central/state sponsored scholarship scheme.
scholarship.document_required:
1. Caste certificate, if applicable, issued in the name of the student or the father by the SDM/Deputy Commissioner (Revenue), GNCTD. In case caste certificate has not been issued by competent authority of Govt of NCT, then Domicile Certificate of students issued by competent authority of Delhi may be submitted.
  2. Annual family income certificate issued by the Revenue Department, GNCT of Delhi.
  3. Bank Account should be in the name of the student (Joint Bank Account with parent/Guardian is also permissible), active and seeded with Aadhaar no of student.
  4. Residence Proof
scholarship.grievance_redressal:
Call: 011-23379512
Visti: Department for Welfare of SC/ST/OBC/Minorities,
B Block, 2nd Floor, Vikas Bhawan,
Government of NCT of Delhi,
IP Estate New Delhi- 110002

scholarship.name: Pre Matric Scholarship for SC Students
scholarship.award_entitlement: This is Centrally sponsored Scheme under the Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment.Government of India Per annum scholarship of Rs. 3500/- for day scholars and Rs. 7000/- for hostellers.
scholarship.eligibility:
1. The student should not be getting any other centrally/state funded scholarship.
  2. The student should be of Classes IX and X studying in a Government school or in a School recognized by Govt. of a Central/State Board of Secondary Education.
  3. There is no minimum percentage of marks required.
  4. The student should have a bank account in their name & seeded with Aadhaar of student.
scholarship.document_required:
1. Caste certificate, if applicable, issued in the name of the student or the father by the SDM/Deputy Commissioner (Revenue), GNCTD. In case caste certificate has not been issued by competent authority of Govt of NCT, then Domicile Certificate of students issued by competent authority of Delhi may be submitted.
  2. Annual family income certificate issued by the Revenue Department, GNCT of Delhi.
  3. Bank Account should be in the name of the student (Joint Bank Account with parent/Guardian is also permissible), active and seeded with Aadhaar no of student.
  4. Residence Proof.
scholarship.grievance_redressal:
Call: 011-23379512
Visti: Department for Welfare of SC/ST/OBC/Minorities,
B Block, 2nd Floor, Vikas Bhawan,
Government of NCT of Delhi,
IP Estate New Delhi- 110002

scholarship.name: Begum Hazarat Mahal National Scholarship
scholarship.award_entitlement:
1. Minority community girls student for Class 9th to 12th student belonging to National minority communities.
  2. Rupees 5000 for class 9th and 10th Rupees 6000 for class 11th and 12th
scholarship.eligibility:
1. The student should not be getting any other centrally/state funded scholarship.
  2. The student should be of Classes IX and X studying in a Government school or in a School recognized by Govt. of a Central/State Board of Secondary Education.
  3. There is no minimum percentage of marks required.
  4. The student should have a bank account in their name & seeded with Aadhaar of student.

In case caste certificate has not been issued by competent authority of Govt of NCT, then Domicile Certificate of students issued by competent authority of Delhi may be submitted.
